hanzi-su-wiki:
土

Значения

Земля; почва; грунт. Территория; местность. Пыль. Местный. Провинциализм; провинциальность; заурядный

🔑32

Мнемоника

  • Верхний и нижний слои почвы с ростком между ними.

  • Росток прорастает из почвы.

Описание

Книга «Три иероглифа» содержит следующие строки: «Вода, огонь, дерево, металл и земля — это пять элементов, от которых ведут свое происхождение все вещи». Таким образом, земля является одним из пяти источников природы. Достаточно посмотреть на сетку полей в современном Китае, чтобы понять, сколь глубоко китайцы ощущают свою связь с землей.

Этот ключ состоит из трех черт: верхняя — верхний слой земли, который можно возделывать, нижняя — подпочва, каменистая, но плодородная; вертикальная черта символизирует все то, что выходит из почвы на поверхность, все плоды земли. Если к этому ключу добавить «сердце» и поставить сверху «руку», это будет значить «странный», «необычный»; руки человека, обрабатывая землю, изменяют ее. В сочетании с иероглифами «рука» и «солнце» ключ описывает производство глиняных статуэток: человек обрабатывает землю, а затем оставляет ее сушиться на солнце. В «Истории династии Сун» (960—1270) этот иероглиф используется в значении «местный», «родной».

怪 странный
捏 обрабатывать глину
土人 родной
土话 местный диалект

Произношение и тон

tǔ
📢 Туман стелется по земле.

♫ Земля — третья планета от Солнца (3-й тон).

Варианты

圡, 𡈽

heisig_chinese_memo: Under every tombstone is someone buried in the soil.
heisig_story: I don't like it any more than you do, but this kanji is not the pictograph it is trumped up to be: a mound of soil piled on the ground. All I can recommend is that you memorize it as it is. Anyway, it will be occurring with such frequency that you have almost no chance of forgetting it, even if you try.
koohiiStory1: Remembering soil is easy. If soil is soft, you can take a walking stick and plunge it two* feet into the ground.
koohiiStory2: King Arthur pulled the magical sword Excalibur out of the hardened soil to claim his place as king.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The dirt radical and the dirt kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: As long as you know the radical dirt, you know the kanji dirt.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who spends a lot of time in dirt? Dogs (ど) do! Dogs dig in dirt, they roll in dirt, sometimes they try to eat dirt (which isn't so great).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Dogs and dirt just go together!
Ru_trainchinese:
tǔ: (сущ) почва, земля; территория
tǔ: (ключ) земля
tǔ: (прил) простоватый, примитивный, старомодный; местный, коренной; неочищенный; домашний
tǔ: (сущ) (кит. мед.) земля
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Under every tombstone is someone buried in the soil.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The monument features the three supreme existences of the Universe: Heaven (天), Earth(地), and Human (人)— and the five basic elements of the universe: water(水), fire(火), iron (金), wood(木), soil(土) (14th-19th century) ,Along with Heaven, the Earth was an object of worship. The people who developed the Hanzi system built an earthen pillar (土, tu, earth). In fact, the pillar means ten (十, shi, ten) which also means ‘many’. So we can see this character describes the land from which many creatures sprout. The “Shuo Wen Jie Zi (Explanation of Chinese Characters)” written about 2,000 years ago says that “ ‘Tu’ means that earth regurgitates living things.” In other words, all the living things came from the Earth. Therefore, in ancient society, it was very important to worship Mother Earth which gave birth to all living things.,Ancient eastern people worshiped the earth. So, they tried to preserve the natural land rather than cultivate and develop it. They thought of the earth as their mother because all the creatures come from the earth. (里, li, place, inside) The upper one (田, tian=t’ien, field) means field divided into four places, and lower one (土, tu, soil) means the earth on which some corps are rising, and it also means an altar people gathering. The whole character means the village where people gather in the field, performing rites. In the past, people considered that the earth of their hometown would protect them, and they worshiped the god of their own territory by building an altar. This god of hometown would judge the people of the village whether to go to Heaven or to go to hell. (理, li, manage, reason) The left side of the symbol (玉, yu=yü, jade) is a jade bead, and the right side is a village where people live together. The ancient people believed that the jade are so pure than any other existences of the earth, and they believed that the jade is a soul of the land which can defeat the evil spirits. Because jade (玉) can judge people of the village with the spirit of the earth (土), is used as a meaning of control, manage, reason etc.,For ancient East Asian people, nature was to be revered. When they gazed upon the clear night skies and many stars above, they thought that the stars were like spirits of people. (星, xing=hsing star) When we see this character, it shows the green plants (屮) coming up from the earth (土), which symbolizes full of life (生, sheng, to live, life), and stars scattered around it (晶, jing, brilliant; crystal). In ancient dictionary, it was explained that “stars are spirits of all living things”. According to the explanations, the stars or the constellations are related to the spirits of living things. Why did the ancient people connect the stars with the spirit?,The ancient Chinese considered that there were five essential elements in the universe: Water (水, shui), Fire (火, huo), Wood (木, mu), Iron (金, jin), and Earth (土, tu). The five main elements interact and create each other or restrain each other. For example, the tree burns and creates fire which burns down to ashes and becomes earth (soil). Water restrains fire and fire can melt metal. (五, wu, five) contains such philosophical meanings. The top line means sky , the bottom line is earth , and the middle shows how the “five elements” cross and interact with each other.,(金, jin, gold; metal) has a lid covering the top of the object and something under it (今, jin, now), and a soil beneath it (土, tu, soil), and some points dotted around them . As a whole, this character means gathering the shiny particles that are contained in the soil. It originally meant various metals contained in the soil, but later it came to mean gold.,Since vaccines were not discovered yet, there were many dogs with rabies. The English expression “rabid dog” had a strong meaning back in those times. Dogs that had rabies went mad and bit people and showed ferocity. People had to be very careful not to be bitten by mad dogs. The character (狂, kuang, mad) describes this kind of situation. The left part of this character means a foot (止, zhi=chih, stop) on a high mound (土, tu, soil). On the right, there is a dog. In other words, it depicts someone stopped on a high place and a dog beneath it barking ferociously.
humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of a pile of dirt piled up on the ground (Xu Jinxiong, Li Xiaoding, Xu Zhongshu). The dots are like dirt particles. The original meaning is mound, and the extension means land. One said that it was like the god-lord who offered sacrifices to the land, which was later called the " community ." In ancient times, the earth was sealed and standing stones were used to worship the gods of the land (Peng Yushang, Dai Jiaxiang, Zhang Shichao). The little elephant gives a gift to the landlord (Shirakawa Jing).

Oracle read as " community " is the land of God (Wang Guowei), "Collection" 14395: "Liao in the soil." Jia Jinwen means territory and land, "Collection" 36975: "Xitu receives the year, lucky." It means that there is a good harvest in Xitu. Da Yuding: "Received by the People and Territory", "Shangshu. "Luo Gao": "Born to protect civil and martial arts by the people." It also means that the earth is opposite to the sky. Ai Cheng Shuding: "Always use gluttonous sacrifices, die in the soil, and take care of the public. Don't be slack." " Death " is interpreted as " corpse ", which means the chief priest, "Zuo Zhuan. "Five Years of Chenggong": "The Lord of the Mountains and Rivers", Du pre-annotated: "The Lord is the priest of the Suo." "Die in the soil" means the God of Mountains and Rivers (Ma Chengyuan). Five years of Yan Shenggui: "Publicity in the soil", equivalent to "Poetry. Lu Song. "Yugong": "Tutian vassals" (Sun Yirang). The inscription "𤔲土" is an official name, which is equivalent to the "Situ" in the classics. It is in charge of land and agricultural production, and occasionally leads soldiers on expeditions and serves as a bridegroom. Nangong Hu Zhong: "𤔲Tu Nangong Hu".

"Shuowen": "Earth, the earth spit out creatures. In the two things under the earth, things appear in shape. All the belongings of the earth come from the earth."
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of a pile of soil on the ground (Xu Jinxiong, Li Xiaoding, Xu Zhongshu). The dots are like dirt particles. The original meaning is mound, and the extension means land.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文象地上堆起的土塊之形(許進雄、李孝定、徐中舒)。小點象土粒。本義是土堆，引申表示土地。一說象祭祀土地的神主，即後來的「社」。古時封土立石以為祭祀土地的神主(彭裕商、戴家祥、張世超)。小點象對地主行灌禮(白川靜)。

　　甲骨文讀為「社」，是土地之神(王國維)，《合集》14395：「尞于土」。甲金文表示領土、土地，《合集》36975：「西土受年，吉。」表示西土有好收成。大盂鼎：「受民受疆土」，《尚書．洛誥》：「誕保文武受民」。又表示與上天相對之下土。哀成叔鼎：「永用禋祀，死于下土，以事康公，勿或能怠。」「死」釋讀為「尸」，表示主祭，《左傳．成公五年》：「國主山川」，杜預注：「主，謂所主祭。」「死于下土」即主祭山川之神(馬承源)。五年琱生簋：「僕庸土田」，相當於《詩．魯頌．閟宮》：「土田附庸」(孫詒讓)。金文「𤔲土」是官名，相當於典籍的「司徒」，主管土地、農業生產，偶爾帶兵出征和冊命時作儐右。南宮乎鐘：「𤔲土南宫乎」。

　　《說文》：「土，地之吐生物者也。二象地之下地之中，物出形也。凡土之屬皆从土。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象地上堆起的土塊之形(許進雄、李孝定、徐中舒)。小點象土粒。本義是土堆，引申表示土地。

Traditional in your browser 繁体字的浏览器显示:土

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+571F

Main pronunciation 主要发音: tǔ

Other pronunciations 其它发音: tǔ,dù,chǎ,tú

Original meaning 本义: Meaning earth

English senses 英语理解: soil, earth; items made of earth

Usage example 用法举例: 土地 tǔ dì (earth)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 519

Shuowen 说文解字: 地之吐生物者也二象地之下地之中物出形也凡土之屬皆從土

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Component 土 mutant 圡 (name- potters-clay 土 tǔ)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- a potters wheel with a lump of clay indicating earth, clay, sometimes land) (-大 in 去厺㚎 赤灻𤆍 𦍒羍 走𣥚𧺆 幸𠂷𡴘) (-土 in 全 生𤯓㞢 𡈼垂對 重𡍴 堇𡏳 𡉚凷坐在 毁毀) (-之 in 寺) (-other 壳𡉉𠕓 主 黑𪐗 圥𡴆 牡庄𤴶莊) (-phonetic 肚) (-cognate 塞地)

①地面上的泥沙混合物：土壤。黄土。
②疆域：国土。领土。
③本地的，地方性的：故土。
④民间生产的(区别于“洋”)：土方(民间流传的药方，亦称“偏方”)。
⑤不合潮流：土气。
⑥未熬制的鸦片：烟土。
⑦中国古代乐器八音之一。
⑧中国少数民族，主要分布于青海省：土族。
⑨姓氏。

Kun-Yomi: つち
Heisig constituents: soil, dirt, ground
Heisig: I don't like it any more than you do, but this kanji is not the pictograph it is trumped up to be: a mound of soil piled on the ground. All I can recommend is that you memorize it as it is. Anyway, it will be occurring with such frequency that you have almost no chance of forgetting it, even if you try.
* As a primitive, the sense of soil is extended to that of ground because of its connection with the kanji for the same (Frame 554). From there it also takes the added meanings of dirt and land.

甲金文象地上堆起的土塊之形(許進雄、李孝定、徐中舒)。小點象土粒。本義是土堆，引申表示土地。一說象祭祀土地的神主，即後來的「 社 」。古時封土立石以為祭祀土地的神主(彭裕商、戴家祥、張世超)。小點象對地主行灌禮(白川靜)。 甲骨文讀為「 社 」，是土地之神(王國維)，《合集》14395：「尞于土」。甲金文表示領土、土地，《合集》36975：「西土受年，吉。」表示西土有好收成。大盂鼎：「受民受疆土」，《尚書．洛誥》：「誕保文武受民」。又表示與上天相對之下土。哀成叔鼎：「永用禋祀，死于下土，以事康公，勿或能怠。」「 死 」釋讀為「 尸 」，表示主祭，《左傳．成公五年》：「國主山川」，杜預注：「主，謂所主祭。」「死于下土」即主祭山川之神(馬承源)。五年琱生簋：「僕庸土田」，相當於《詩．魯頌．閟宮》：「土田附庸」(孫詒讓)。金文「𤔲土」是官名，相當於典籍的「司徒」，主管土地、農業生產，偶爾帶兵出征和冊命時作儐右。南宮乎鐘：「𤔲土南宫乎」。 《說文》：「土，地之吐生物者也。二象地之下地之中，物出形也。凡土之屬皆从土。」
The shape of a pile of dirt piled up on the ground (Xu Jinxiong, Li Xiaoding, Xu Zhongshu). The dots are like dirt particles. The original meaning is mound, and the extension means land. One said that it was like the god-lord who offered sacrifices to the land, which was later called the " community." In ancient times, the earth was sealed and standing stones were used to worship the gods of the land (Peng Yushang, Dai Jiaxiang, Zhang Shichao). The little elephant gives a gift to the landlord (Shirakawa Jing). Oracle read as " community" is the land of God (Wang Guowei), "Collection" 14395: "Liao in the soil." Jia Jinwen means territory and land, "Collection" 36975: "Xitu receives the year, lucky." It means that there is a good harvest in Xitu. Da Yuding: "Received by the People and Territory", "Shangshu. "Luo Gao": "Born to protect civil and martial arts by the people." It also means that the earth is opposite to the sky. Ai Cheng Shuding: "Always use gluttonous sacrifices, die in the soil, and take care of the public. Don't be slack." " Death" is interpreted as " corpse", which means the chief priest, "Zuo Zhuan. "Five Years of Chenggong": "The Lord of the Mountains and Rivers", Du pre-annotated: "The Lord is the priest of the Suo." "Die in the soil" means the God of Mountains and Rivers (Ma Chengyuan). Five years of Yan Shenggui: "Publicity in the soil", equivalent to "Poetry. Lu Song. "Yugong": "Tutian vassals" (Sun Yirang). The inscription "𤔲土" is an official name, which is equivalent to the "Situ" in the classics. It is in charge of land and agricultural production, and occasionally leads soldiers on expeditions and serves as a bridegroom. Nangong Hu Zhong: "𤔲Tu Nangong Hu". "Shuowen": "Earth, the earth spit out creatures. In the two things under the earth, things appear in shape. All the belongings of the earth come from the earth."

(2)通“杜”。古水名。

【唐韻】【正韻】他魯切【集韻】【韻會】統五切，?吐上聲。五行之一。【說文】地之吐生物者也。二象地之下，地之中，土物出形也。【易·離彖傳】百穀草木麗乎土。【書·禹貢】冀州厥土惟白壤，兗州厥土黑墳，靑州厥土白墳，徐州厥土赤埴墳，揚州荆州厥土惟塗泥，豫州厥土惟壤下土墳壚，梁州厥土靑黎，雍州厥土惟黃壤。　又【書·禹貢】徐州厥貢惟土五色。【註】諸侯受命，各錫以方色土，建大社于國中，一曰冢土。【詩·大雅】乃立冢土。　又后土，取厚載之義。共工氏子句龍爲后土，位在中央，主於四季各十八日。【禮·月令】中央土，其日戊己，其帝黃帝，其神后土。【周禮·冬官考工記】土以黃，其象方。　又星土，星所主土。【周禮·春官】保章氏以星土辨九州之地。　又度也。土圭之土訓度。詳圭字註。　又業也。【皇極經世】獨夫以百畝爲土，大夫以百里爲土，諸侯以四境爲土，天子以九州爲土，仲尼以萬世爲土。　又星名，一曰鎮星。【漢書】作塡。詳塡字註。　又地名。【春秋·僖二十八年】公會晉侯，齊侯，宋公，蔡侯，鄭

Земля — третья планета от Солнца (3-й тон).

土

Значения

Земля; почва; грунт. Территория; местность. Пыль. Местный. Провинциализм; провинциальность; заурядный

🔑32

Мнемоника

  • Верхний и нижний слои почвы с ростком между ними.

  • Росток прорастает из почвы.

Описание

Книга «Три иероглифа» содержит следующие строки: «Вода, огонь, дерево, металл и земля — это пять элементов, от которых ведут свое происхождение все вещи». Таким образом, земля является одним из пяти источников природы. Достаточно посмотреть на сетку полей в современном Китае, чтобы понять, сколь глубоко китайцы ощущают свою связь с землей.

Этот ключ состоит из трех черт: верхняя — верхний слой земли, который можно возделывать, нижняя — подпочва, каменистая, но плодородная; вертикальная черта символизирует все то, что выходит из почвы на поверхность, все плоды земли. Если к этому ключу добавить «сердце» и поставить сверху «руку», это будет значить «странный», «необычный»; руки человека, обрабатывая землю, изменяют ее. В сочетании с иероглифами «рука» и «солнце» ключ описывает производство глиняных статуэток: человек обрабатывает землю, а затем оставляет ее сушиться на солнце. В «Истории династии Сун» (960—1270) этот иероглиф используется в значении «местный», «родной».
